name: Marc Broussard
description:
'''Marc Broussard''' (born January 14, 1982) is an American singer-songwriter. His style is best described as "[[bayou]] [[Soul music|soul]]", a mix of [[funk]], [[blues]], [[R&B]], [[rock music|rock]] and [[pop music|pop]], matched with distinct [[Southern United States|Southern]] roots. He has released twelve studio albums, one live album, and three [[Extended play|EP]]s, and has charted twice on [[Hot Adult Top 40 Tracks]].

Broussard has performed on TV programs including ''[[The Tonight Show with Jay Leno]]'', ''[[Breakfast with the Arts]]'', ''[[Jimmy Kimmel Live!]]'', ''[[Late Night with Conan O'Brien]]'', ''[[The Early Show]]'', ''[[Larry King Live]]'', ''[[Lopez Tonight]]'', and CBS's ''Saturday Morning's Second Cup Cafe''. His music has been featured on shows such as ''[[Clash of the Choirs]]'', in which "Home" was performed by a [[Blake Shelton]]â€“led choir.
